p: Table 2 and Figures 3 and 4 report key indicators that characterize the historical role of PAT exposure in HCV transmission. The population proportion of PAT exposure was increasing with the mass campaigns and estimated at 0.2% in 1950, 5.1% in 1960 and 17.2% in 1970 ( Figure 3A). It reached a peak of 18.8% in 1974 and declined thereafter to 8.5% by 2000 and 3.8% by 2018 ( Figure 3A). The cumulative number of individuals who have ever been exposed to PAT was 8.3 million by 2018, but the number of them who were alive was 7.3 million in 1980, 5.6 million in 2000 and only 3.5 million in 2018 ( Table 2).
